HTML:
About TensorOps:



At TensorOps, we're at the forefront of AI innovation, transforming industries with groundbreaking solutions in traditional machine learning, Gen AI, AI agents, Ad Tech, Search, and Recommendation Systems. We empower both startups and established enterprises‚Äîfrom large public companies to digital-native early-movers‚Äîwith strategies that drive success. With a clientele that includes industry leaders like JFrog, Notion, MinuteMedia, and Clever Advertising, and trusted partnerships with Google Cloud and AWS, we are redefining what's possible in AI.

Your Role: Mid-Level AI/ML Engineer

As a Mid-Level AI/ML Engineer at TensorOps, you'll work on exciting, real-world projects that leverage the power of AI to solve complex problems. You'll join a team of forward-thinking experts, contributing to projects from ideation to deployment, and expanding your skills in a collaborative and innovative environment.

What You'll Do:

  • Develop & Implement Models: Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and AI solutions that drive business impact‚Äîensuring solutions meet production standards and drive measurable business results.
  • Collaborative Engineering: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications and innovative solutions. Implement best practices for scalable, maintainable code and efficient integration into deployment pipelines.
  • Research & Innovation: Stay updated with the latest AI/ML research and effectively integrate innovative techniques into our production workflows.
  • Model Optimization: Regularly monitor, evaluate, and fine-tune model performance using industry-standard metrics to ensure robust, scalable, and production-ready solutions.
  • Documentation: Maintain clear and concise documentation for models, methodologies, and processes.

Who We're Looking For:

  • Mid-Level AI/ML Engineer: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in AI/ML engineering with a proven track record of deploying and optimizing models in production environments.
  • Technical Proficiency: Solid foundation in programming languages such as Python, and familiarity with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
  • Cloud Experience: Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure) for deploying and managing ML models.
  • Problem Solver: Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot issues and optimize algorithms.
  • Collaborative Mindset: Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented attitude to work effectively with diverse stakeholders.
  • Educational Background: A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field

Why TensorOps?

  • Innovative Environment: Join a forward-thinking team that is pushing the boundaries of AI technology.
  • Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the benefits of remote work while collaborating with a dynamic team across Europe.
  • Competitive Benefits: Enjoy a range of employee-centric perks, including health and wellness programs (like a gym membership via Urban Sports Club), a monthly stipend in Bolt credits, and access to co-working spaces.
  • Growth & Learning: Thrive in a culture that values continuous learning, offering ample opportunities for professional development and innovation.

If you're ready to uplift your career in AI/ML engineering and work on projects that make a real impact, we'd love to hear from you. Join us at TensorOps and help shape the future of AI innovation.

Apply Now!

Title: Junior Data Scientist/Engineer
HTML:
Acceleration is WPP‚Äôs data and technology consultancy, operated globally by leading media company GroupM. We work closely with GroupM agencies (EssenceMediacom, Mindhsare and Wavemaker) and Google center of excellence to connect our clients' media investments to tangible business results, powering possibilities and performance through data and technology.

We make data and technology work better for people and business!

Click to discover more about Acceleration and GroupM.

We are seeking a highly motivated and adaptable Junior Data Scientist/Engineer to join our small, dynamic team in Lisbon, Portugal. This entry-level role offers a unique opportunity to gain broad experience across various data-focused disciplines, including machine learning, data engineering, and business intelligence.

The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in programming, a passion for data analysis, and a willingness to learn and contribute across different areas.

This position provides excellent growth potential within a supportive team environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Machine Learning: Develop, implement, and deploy machine learning models. Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering. Train and evaluate models;
  • Data Engineering: Support the building and maintenance of data pipelines. Assist in data processing and transformation. Work with databases under the guidance of senior team members;
  • Business Intelligence: Contribute to the development of reports and dashboards. Assist in data analysis and identification of trends;
  • Collaborate with other team members on projects across these disciplines;
  • Actively learn and develop skills in ML/AI, data engineering, and BI;
  • Contribute to the overall improvement of our data capabilities.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 1+ year of experience in a data-related role or demonstrable project experience (including internships or academic projects);
  • Strong programming skills in Python;
  • Experience with data warehousing concepts;
  • Experience with data visualization tools;
  • Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Basic understanding of data visualization principles;
  • Basic understanding of SQL and relational databases;
  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms;
  • Familiarity with data manipulation and cleaning techniques;
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills;
  • Good communication and teamwork skills. A strong desire to learn and adapt is essential.
  • Fluent Portuguese language skills.

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Marketing Data Scientist.

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone‚Äôs day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Develop Data-Driven Insights: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights from large and diverse datasets across different European markets, driving strategic marketing decisions and commercial execution optimization.
Utilising ML methods (e.g supervised, unsupervised) on an Azure platform with languages such as Python, build and implement Predictive Models: Design, build, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to identify market trends, customer behaviour, and business process outcomes.
Analyze Multi-Channel Marketing Data: Integrate and analyze data from various marketing channels (e.g., transactional, firmographic, behavioral, digital data from advertising, social media, email campaigns) to assess performance, identify patterns, generate usable segmentations and recommend improvements to amplify future success of activities.
Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with marketing, sales, and data teams to ensure alignment of data science initiatives with business goals. Enable analysts to further work on data points and reach data-driven recommendations to support in strategic planning and decision-making processes.
Ensure compliance to the Machine Learning Lifecycle from Data gathering through to Deployment. Appropriate checks and balances along with sufficient validation steps should be incorporated to maintain Data Quality and Compliance (e.g. GDPR and internal data governance policies)


What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Advanced Data Analysis and Modeling: Proficiency in statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, with experience in coding with Python, R, and SQL along with a good knowledge of Databricks is important. Knowledge of tools like Power BI for translating data into insights is a benefit.
Experience with Marketing Analytics: Strong background in analyzing and interpreting marketing data, with knowledge of marketing metrics, customer segmentation, and business performance evaluation.
Multi-Channel Data Integration: Expertise in integrating and analyzing data from various sources, including digital marketing platforms, CRM systems, large transactional databases, to create in depth intelligent views of customer cohorts.
Strong Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders, including creating detailed reports, visualizations, and presentations.
Cross-Cultural and Regional Awareness: Understanding of the nuances and variations in marketing practices and consumer behavior across different European markets, with the ability to adapt strategies to diverse regional needs.


What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we‚Äôre ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

Our Company

FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970‚Äôs. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today‚Äôs global marketplace.

Title: React Developer
Description:
GREAT FREELANCE OPPORTUNITY FOR A REACT DEVELOPER IN PORTUGAL - LUCRATIVE RATE!




Job Title: React Developer

Contract Type: Freelance

Location: Porto, Portugal (Hybrid/Remote options available)

Rate: ‚Ç¨450/day




Key Info:

My client is a dynamic and forward-thinking company based in Porto, passionate about creating innovative web applications that serve a diverse range of industries. The team thrives on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning.




This exciting organisation are currently seeking a skilled React Developer to join their growing development team and help build cutting-edge digital products.




Job Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain high-quality, reusable, and scalable React applications.
Collaborate with UX/UI designers, product managers, and backend developers to create seamless, user-friendly web experiences.
Write clean, well-documented code following best practices and coding standards.
Optimise applications for maximum performance and scalability across various devices and browsers.
Implement unit and integration tests to ensure high code quality.
Participate in code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and ensure the application architecture is robust and scalable.
Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in front-end development, React, and web technologies.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a React Developer or in a similar front-end development role.
Strong knowledge of React.js, JavaScript, and modern front-end technologies (HTML5, CSS3, ES6+).
Experience with Redux for state management, React Router, and other modern React tools.
Understanding of RESTful APIs and integration with front-end applications.
Familiarity with front-end build tools such as Webpack, Babel, and NPM/Yarn.
Experience with testing frameworks like Jest, Enzyme, or React Testing Library is a plus.
Knowledge of Git and version control practices.
Ability to write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills in English (both written and verbal). Portuguese is a plus but not required.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).




Nice to Have:

Experience with Next.js or other server-side rendering frameworks.
Familiarity with TypeScript.
Experience in a Agile/Scrum development environment.
Familiarity with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure) or CI/CD pipelines.







Please contact info@optimistech.co to learn more about this amazing opportunity!
